User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Smart Companion application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

googleId.description: The user's Google ID (if they signed up with Google). Null if they didn't.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. The document ID is the Firebase Auth UID. This enables path-based ownership, making security rules straightforward. No task-related data is stored here, preserving the application's privacy focus.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

firestore.reasoning: Given the privacy-first requirement of the Smart Companion application, storing data in IndexedDB is the primary method. However, to potentially support future features or user account management (even if initially minimal), a basic Firestore structure is proposed. This structure focuses on user identification and avoids storing any task-related data directly, adhering to the privacy constraint. The core concept is Authorization Independence. This structure ensures that security rules can be written without the need for `get()` calls, crucial for atomicity and scalability.
